text: {| class=wikitable align=right width="290" !bgcolor=#e7dcc3 colspan=2|Compound of four cubes |- |align=center colspan=2|280px |- |bgcolor=#e7dcc3|Type||Compound |- |bgcolor=#e7dcc3|Convex hull||Chamfered cube |- |bgcolor=#e7dcc3|Polyhedra||4 cubes |- |bgcolor=#e7dcc3|Faces||32 squares |- |bgcolor=#e7dcc3|Edges||48 |- |bgcolor=#e7dcc3|Vertices||8+24 |- |bgcolor=#e7dcc3|Symmetry group||octahedral (Oh) |- |bgcolor=#e7dcc3|Subgroup restricting to one constituent||3-fold antiprismatic (D3d) |} A compound of four cubes is a face-transitive polyhedron compound that is a symmetric arrangement of four cubes, as trigonal trapezohedrons. It can be constructed by dual of compound of four octahedra. Its surface area is 687/77 square lengths of the edge.http://mathworld.wolfram.com/Cube4-Compound.html == Cartesian coordinates == With added fifth cube Cartesian coordinates for the vertices of this compound are: : (±3, ±3, ±3) : (±5, ±1, ±1) : (±1, ±5, ±1) : (±1, ±1, ±5) ==See also== *Compound of three octahedra *Compound of five octahedra *Compound of ten octahedra *Compound of twenty octahedra *Compound of six cubes == References == Category:Polyhedral compounds
title: Compound of four cubes
